item.title: Terpsicore add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Terpsicore add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Terpsicore add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Terpsicore add a quote by Henry Ward Beecher
item.description: "A book is a garden, an orchard, a storehouse, a party, a company by the way, a counselor, a multitude of counselors." -- Henry Ward Beecher

item.title: Terpsicore add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Terpsicore add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "You can't put your feet on the ground until you've touched the sky." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Terpsicore add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "What is the meaning of life? That was all- a simple question; one that tended to close in on one with years, the great revelation had never come. The great revelation perhaps never did come. Instead, there were little daily miracles, illuminations, matches struck unexpectedly in the dark; here was one." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Terpsicore add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "Unbeing dead isn't being alive." -- E. E. Cummings
